column3: Pssshkoh... Backrix is keeper of knowings and data! ...But Backrix has nothing to teach uplander this day!
Pssshkoh... Backrix is keeper of knowings and data. What does uplander wish to learn?
What will you ask?
Tell me about yourself.
What kind of place is this?
Watcherbook I-1.
Watcherbook I-2.
Watcherbook I-3.
Nothing.
Uplander wishes to know background data of Backrix? Very well.
Backrix keeps eyes on Illuminati stronghold. But why is Backrix chosen, uplander will wonder.

It is by request of Slowfix. Many gobbies like tinkermaking tools and machinery. But Backrix has braincase like steel trap\xe2\x94\x80catching all heard things, all seen things. So where Illuminati gather, there does watch of Backrix begin.
Pssshkoh... Shortstop is where gobbies of Idyllshire keep watch, for Illuminati can never be trusted.
They have made a base inside giant of metal. It is old machine, left by uplanders of Sharlayan to rust. But with many hammerings Illuminati repair, and give it movement. Yes, it once stood!

But luck is on side of Idyllshire, and giant of metal failed. It came to a shuddering stop, and fell over into the lake. But if awakes again, then Idyllshire is ending\xe2\x94\x80crushed under feet of iron!
Pssshkoh... Give Backrix a moment... There, now uplander can read gobbie account.

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Illuminati posed a threat to Idyllshire from their stronghold inside Sharlayan ruins. But when stronghold becomes a colossus of iron, and begins to climb out of river, then does gobbieflock turn to Scions for aid.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Nowtimes headgob of Illuminati is Quickthinx Allthoughts. He desires to make all knowings his own, takes ancient technologies at point of fighty-tool, and keeps secrets clenched tight in fist of iron.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Colossus of iron is no doubt Illuminati handiwork. Y'shtola says it feeds on aether, is draining hinterlands with much fastness. Land will be emptied if it stirs again.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03But Illuminati magic barrier protects giant, and has since great shiveryshaking of ground three years past. Backrix thought Sharlayan ruins were freed from river bottom then, and came bobbing to surface.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03But daughter of Slowfix says different. Roundrox claims that giant stood then, and ground quivered under its feet-thumping. Cid believes her, thinks that someone tried to summon primal and failed.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Backrix knew of claim, but thought it was just imaginings. Roundrox is only little gobbie, after all. But she is proved right, and finds another with eyes for shiny junk and trinkets. Never has Backrix seen Roundrox so happy as when she is with uplander treasure hunter\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03.
Pssshkoh... Here\xe2\x94\x80all new facts of case, for you to see.

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Cid asked Backrix to learn more of\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 Enigma Codex\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03. Data is sparse, but Backrix has confirmed it was written one hundred years ago by a genius machina-maker. It is brimful of plans and ideas, each as fantastic as the next.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Greatest among these are designs for a walking citadel, name of \xe2\x80\x9cAlexander.\xe2\x80\x9d It is designed as a utopia of learning, logic, and reason\xe2\x94\x80part machina, part dream.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03The citadel would be open only to scholars and tinkerers with giant braincases. It could make its own water and food, and never need anything from outside itself. Thinkers could wander the realm, deepening their knowings, spreading their wisdoms, and building the perfect world.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Backrix understands why some gobbies would have lustyeyes for this. Gobbieflock wander, never staying too long in one place and backstrapping precious things. Where better to live than home that walks?\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03But making citadel real, this is frightful. Alexander Initiative is reason for Illuminati to be, and they use all their learnings and cunning to make it come true!\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03And if they succeed, then colossus of iron will power itself through aether, and suck dry the lands. Inside could be safe, but outside everything dies. So gobbies and uplanders are of one mind\xe2\x94\x80core of colossus must be destroyed.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03There is great peril even for grown uplanders, and Roundrox cannot join them. Daughter of Slowfix must stay behind, and has sad look to her. Maybe Backrix should take her junk hunting, like in past-times.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
Pssshkoh... Uplander wishes for that record?

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Uplanders and gobbies have found a fragment of\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 Enigma Codex\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03. It is small piece of crystal that holds all plans and designs for Alexander, and is unlike any book Backrix has ever seen.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03It was hidden in plain sight very near Backrix\xe2\x94\x80among collection of Roundrox. Daughter of Slowfix picked it up near Sharlayan ruins three years ago, and kept it here as her favorite treasure.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Fragment is dull, dark, but in hands of Roundrox it lights up. It shines strange patterns and symbols into the air above itself. Is it magic or lost science? Backrix has touched it several times, but it does not work for him.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Mide has read it, says it speaks of controlling spread of technologies. More advanced machina are dangerous, and their knowings should be held by chosen few. Otherwise, there is great risk of people misusing things they do not understand.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Mide claims it is so goodly thinkers can do good things, but Backrix has doubts about this. Good ideals often lead to bad places. Even if that were not so, Illuminati are not good. In seeing ideas made real, they will become self-righteous and go far, far astray.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Glowstone of Roundrox is only one part of codex, of course. Mide wishes to find the rest, can sell the ideas for great heaps of jinglyshine.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

(-Watcherbook-)\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Illuminati still seek fragments, too, want to find all of \x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03Enigma Codex\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03. But they call favorite treasure of Roundrox the missing piece, and Backrix wonders\xe2\x94\x80is there another reason they want the child's glowstone?\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
